newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: HPL, HARD ROCK IN HOTEL DEAL.
newsitem.headline: HPL, HARD ROCK IN HOTEL DEAL.

text.p: Singapore's Hotel Properties Ltd said on Thursday it has signed an agreement to develop hotels and resorts worldwide with Hard Rock Cafe International Inc, a subsidiary of London's The Rank Group Plc.
Using the Hard Rock name, the first resort with a projected investment of US$70 million, is under construction in the Indonesian island of Bali, a company statement said.
The 421-room Bali Hard Rock Hotel & Beach Club is scheduled to open in the second quarter of 1998.

Under the agreement, Hard Rock will provide the licensing to use the Hard Rock name and support the overall theme of each property while a joint venture company Leisure Ventures Pte Ltd (LVPL) will develop and operate each of the units.
LVPL is 50 percent owned by HPL through its wholly-owned unit HPL Singapore Pte Ltd and the remaining 50 percent by HPL's manaing director Ong Beng Seng through Rizona (HK) Ltd.

Hard Rock will receive an initial licensing fee and also receive a separate fee for each new site developed and will continue to receive royalties from each hotel based on the percentage of gross sales.
LVPL is expected to develop a minimum of seven and up to 12 hotels and resorts over a 12 year period.
